bwapiMath

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • bwapiMath.Polygon

  • public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object
    Polygon.java --- Class used for displaying and calculating an area. Mostly used as a wrapper for BWAPI polygons and other custom areas.
    Author:
    P H - 22.04.2017

    • Method Detail

      • generateFromPositions

        public static Polygon generateFromPositions(java.util.List<bwapi.Position> positions)
        Function for generating a Polygon object using a List of BWAPI Positions.
        Parameters:
        positions - the vertices of the Polygon being created.
        Returns:
        a Polygon object with the provided Positions as vertices.

      • generatePointList

        private static java.util.List<Point> generatePointList(bwta.Polygon bwtaPolygon)
        Function for converting the Positions inside a BWTA Polygon to Points.
        Parameters:
        bwtaPolygon - the Polygon that is going to be converted.
        Returns:
        a List of Points which are the vertices of the provided Polygon.

      • getCoveredTilePositions

        public java.util.HashSet<bwapi.TilePosition> getCoveredTilePositions()
                                                              throws PointTypeException
        Function for calculating all TilePositions that are currently being covered by the Polygon itself. This requires the Polygon to use Positions as its Points. TilePositions yield no usable result!
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all TilePositions located inside the Polygon.
        Throws:
        PointTypeException

      • findTopStartingPoint

        private Point findTopStartingPoint()
        Function for finding the top/left most starting Point of all given vertices.
        Returns:
        the top/left most vertex.

      • generatePossibleAdjacentPoints

        private java.util.HashSet<Point> generatePossibleAdjacentPoints(Point point,
                                                                java.util.HashSet<bwapi.TilePosition> checkedTilePositions)
        Function for generating the Points that are the direct neighbours of a provided Point instance with the standard tile-size stored in the Core instance. This includes the Points matching the following orientations:
        • Top-Left
        • Top
        • Top-Right
        • Left
        • Right
        • Bottom-Left
        • Bottom
        • Bottom-Right
        The function then checks if the Points are inside the Polygon and that the TilePositions, which are based on the Points, are not inside the provided HashSet! Only Points matching both criteria are being returned in the resulting HashSet.
        Parameters:
        point - the Point whose neighbours are being generated.
        checkedTilePositions - a HashSet containing all TilePositions that must not be generated by the Points.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing the neighbour Points from the provided Point instance matching the criteria mentioned above.

      • isInsideAndUnchecked

        private boolean isInsideAndUnchecked(Point point,
                                     java.util.HashSet<bwapi.TilePosition> checkedTilePositions)
        Function for checking if a Point is inside the Polygon itself and the TilePosition generated by it is not already in a HashSet of already checked TilePositions.
        Parameters:
        point - the Point instance that is going to be checked.
        checkedTilePositions - the HashSet of TilePositions that are forbidden / already marked.
        Returns:
        true if the Polygon contains the provided Point while the checked TilePosition HashSet does not contain the resulting TilePosition.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Point p)
        Function for test if a Point lies inside the Polygon.
        Parameters:
        p - the Point being tested.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the point lies inside the Polygon.

      • getClosestIntersection

        public Point getClosestIntersection(Line line)
        Function for finding the closest intersection between this Polygon and a given Line. This function returns a single Point or null, if no intersection is found.
        Parameters:
        line - the Line whose closest intersection to its starting Point with the Polygon is being calculated.
        Returns:
        the closest intersection between the given Line and this Polygon relative to the line's starting Point.

      • findIntersections

        public java.util.List<bwapi.Pair<Line,Point>> findIntersections(Line line)
        Function for finding an intersection between this Polygon and a given Line. This function returns a List of Line, Point Pairs. The Points represent the Intersection itself, while the Line is the segment of the Polygon that Point is on.
        Parameters:
        testVector - the Vector whose intersections with the Polygon are being tested.
        Returns:
        a List of Pairs containing Vectors and Points.
        • Line: the segment of the Polygon that is being intersected.
        • Point: the intersection with the Polygon.

      • splitLongEdges

        public void splitLongEdges(int maxEdgeLength)
        Function for splitting all edges of the Polygon into pieces which are smaller or equal to a provided length.
        Parameters:
        maxEdgeLength - the maximum length an edge is allowed to have.

      • splitEdgesInHalfRecursion

        private void splitEdgesInHalfRecursion(int currentIndex,
                                       int nextIndex,
                                       Vector vecToNextPoint,
                                       int maxEdgeLength)
        Recursive function for splitting a edge inside the Polygon into two halves. This continues until all sub-halves have a shorter length then the provided parameter specifies.
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - the index of the starting vertex inside the Polygon.
        nextIndex - the index of the following vertex inside the Polygon.
        vecToNextPoint - the Vector which starts at the starting vertex and leads towards the following vertex.
        maxEdgeLength - the maximum length any edge is allowed to have. Any edge which is longer than this provided value will be split in half.

      • display

        public void display()
        Convenience function. The values being used are the default ones.
        See Also:
        Vector.display(Color, boolean, int, int)

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color)
        Convenience function.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Polygon.

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color,
                    boolean verticesShown)
        Convenience function.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Polygon.
        verticesShown - flag set true if the vertices should be shown, false if not.

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color,
                    boolean verticesShown,
                    int verticesRadius)
        Convenience function.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Polygon.
        verticesShown - flag set true if the vertices should be shown, false if not.
        verticesRadius - the radius of the vertices being shown.

      • display

        public void display(bwapi.Color color,
                    boolean verticesShown,
                    int verticesRadius,
                    boolean verticesFilled)
        Function for displaying the Polygon on the ingame map.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the displayed Polygon.
        verticesShown - flag set true if the vertices should be shown, false if not.
        verticesRadius - the radius of the vertices being shown.
        verticesFilled - flag set true if the vertices should be filled, false if not.
